text: Found in the metal ark beneath Xhotl, the Cube of Darkness is as alien as it is powerful. Viewed up close, this small black cube contains millions of tiny pin-pricks of blinking light, each circling a sphere of pure darkness. By implementing the correct pattern of thoughts, the cube may be opened for a fraction of a second, inexpleciably drawing the very Winds of Magic into its depths.

The Crown's whispered advice lured Azhag into an ambush whereupon he was slain by Arkhan the Black, greatest of Nagash's servants. With the Crown now in his possession, the Great Necromancer's return is imminent.

This holy relic still bears the image of the Bretonnian hero's body, imprinted with his blood when he was mortally wounded. The Cultists of Tzeentch now use this sacred blood of the slain hero in their profane rituals.

Ghal Maraz is the legendary hammer of Sigmar and one of the most potent magical artefacts in the entire world. This rune-encrusted weapon has been the symbol of the Emperor's office ever since the founding of the Empire.
This ancient artifact of the Old Ones was once wielded by the legendary Saurus Kroq-Gar, before his defeat at the hands of Kairos Fateweaver. It has been repurposed into a weapon of dread power.

Brought to the world by the Old Ones, this weapon shimmers with unnatural power. Legends carved on ancient stone claim the blade exists on every plane of reality simultaneously, and that its edge can sever a creature's soul. No earthly force can stop this deadly blade - it penetrates granite and steel as easily as it slices through flesh and bone.

This lance was crafted from the heart of the Major Oak, the largest tree in Bretonnia, which was shattered by lightning the moment Gilles was struck down. Its blackened wood is covered with tiny carvings depicting the twelve battles of Gilles and, despite being harder than stone and diamond sharp, it is lightweight and beautiful to behold.
